original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade on Wednesday, shares edged up on the basis of rumors on a secured International Monetary Fund (IMF) deal for a long awaited 2.9 billion dollars, an analyst said.
“Rumors are going about on the securing an IMF deal, since it was expected in March,” an analyst said.
All Share Price Index (ASPI) edged up 0.53 percent or 48.91 points to 9237.39, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.42 percent or 11.58 points to 2,808.58.
Rumors on the IMF potentially being concluded had sparked interests over banking and insurance counters, the analyst said.
The market generated a revenue of 836 million rupees at 1130 hours.

Sri Lanka saw fuel prices remained unchanged, prior to the price revision Lanka IOC had been getting interest and stimulated buying interest with hopes that fuel prices would increase resulting in increased margins.
Top gainers – John Keells, Sampath Bank and Hayleys. (Colombo/Mar01/2023)
